item.title: [RELEASE/FREE]ForgivenX || V2[FREE]
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

[quote=“Skiire, post:24, topic:442428”][quote author=RevengePK link=topic=545059.msg3995914#msg3995914 date=1337264669]

<!DOCTYPE html>

You’re not making any reference to DTD and I’m glad you’re attempting to make use of HTML5, however when you look inside there’s an awful mess of disorganized div elements. Make use of the new HTML5 specific tags.

The design itself is nice.

I try to format them the best I can. I’m not the best but I’m still learning. I’ve been looking into HTML 5 but is it supported by IE?
[/quote]

I’ve personally given up any hope of Microsoft creating a modernized browser within this century - I design around Firefox/safari/opera and then have another basic website load if IE9/8/7 is detected, I don’t give any consideration to those who use IE6.[/quote]

YesSsSsSsSsSsSsSssss.

Read full topic

item.title: [RELEASE/FREE]ForgivenX || V2[FREE]
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“RevengePK, post:20, topic:442428”][quote author=Skiire link=topic=545059.msg3995773#msg3995773 date=1337235571]

<!DOCTYPE html>

You’re not making any reference to DTD and I’m glad you’re attempting to make use of HTML5, however when you look inside there’s an awful mess of disorganized div elements. Make use of the new HTML5 specific tags.

The design itself is nice.
[/quote]

I try to format them the best I can. I’m not the best but I’m still learning. I’ve been looking into HTML 5 but is it supported by IE?[/quote]

http://people.mozilla.com/~prouget/ie9/

I’ve personally given up any hope of Microsoft creating a modernized browser within this century - I design around Firefox/safari/opera and then have another basic website load if IE9/8/7 is detected, I don’t give any consideration to those who use IE6. Is that right? Yes and no. I say so because it makes my life a lot easier and if you’re still running IE6, I don’t want you on my website anyways. It’s all a matter of perspective. Those who are playing RSPS surely should have enough common sense on how to at least update their browser, so the market for prospective players is hardly narrowed through my mindset.

TL;DR: IE attempts to, but isn’t fully a modernized browser (not even IE9).

EDIT: Take a look at these nifty elements section, nav, article, aside, hgroup, header, footer, and there’s plenty more to be discovered in HTML5. Those are just a few you might want to take a look at rather then using divs.

Read full topic

The tool posted must follow all rules and have an appropriate connection to RS2 private servers. If rules start to get broken and content gets out of hand, this rule will be revoked, and no longer will we allow non-server/non-client material to be posted.

Please, kindly f*ck yourself.
